gov.usgs.anss.edge

Class StaSrvEdge

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.edge.StaSrvEdge

  • public final class StaSrvEdge
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses the Stasrv service (originally on neisa, nsn8) to retrieve metadata from the server. It opens the server only once and keeps the link open so it can be used many times The service has a Timeout thread which can be set to interrupt a transaction by closing the socket at a user specified number of millis (default=30); This is a descendant of the original StaSrv.java, but enhanced to throw IOExceptions and to be using logging via an EdgeThread, and to allow alarms to be sent

        close the connection to the server /** getCoord returns an array with the lat, long, and elev
        Parameters:
        net - The network code
        stat - The station code
        loc - The location code
        Returns:
        Array with lat, long and elev in that order. Zeros if station is unknown.

      • getTranslation

        public java.lang.String getTranslation(java.lang.String net,
                                       java.lang.String stat,
                                       java.lang.String loc,
                                       java.lang.String chan)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Returns net sta loc chan translated into Hydra notation (if net = IR) or into Chicxulub notation otherwise. If no translation is found, the input is echoed (1 line, 15 characters).
        Parameters:
        net - The network code
        stat - The station code
        loc - The location code
        chan - The chanel code
        Returns:
        Array with long name in first and network in second element. Stasrv: Unknown" on error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if opening server is a problem

      • getSACResponse

        public java.lang.String getSACResponse(java.lang.String channel,
                                       java.lang.String date,
                                       java.lang.String unit)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        get the response using the meta data server syntax, if the regular expression is not unique, more than one response might be returned.
        Parameters:
        channel - regular expression to match
        date - Date for the epoch (yyyy/mm/dd-hh:mm)
        unit - The unit of the response (um or nm)
        Returns:
        the SAC response string per the MDS
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if opening server is a problem

      • getSACResponse

        public int getSACResponse(java.lang.String channel,
                          java.lang.String date,
                          java.lang.String unit,
                          java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        get the response using the meta data server syntax, if the regular expression is not unique, more than one response might be returned.
        Parameters:
        channel - regular expression to match
        date - Date for the epoch (yyyy/mm/dd-hh:mm)
        unit - The unit of the response (um or nm)
        sb - A user supplied StringBUilder (user must clear or it will be added to)
        Returns:
        Number of characters in returned stringbuilder
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if opening server is a problem

      • getMetaComment

        public java.lang.String[] getMetaComment(java.lang.String channel)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        return the comment 1=station, 2= network,
        Parameters:
        channel - A channel regular expression
        Returns:
        The array with long name in [0], network in [1] or [0] will contain *** MDS: unknown station"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if opening server is a problem

      • getMetaCoord

        public double[] getMetaCoord(java.lang.String channel)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        return the coordinates using the metadata server method rather than old stasrv
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel regular expression
        Returns:
        Array with three values, if the station/channel is unknown all will be zero
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if opening server is a problem

      • getCookedResponse

        public PNZ getCookedResponse(java.lang.String net,
                             java.lang.String stat,
                             java.lang.String loc,
                             java.lang.String chan)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns net sta loc chan translated into Hydra notation (if net = IR) or into Chicxulub notation otherwise. If no translation is found, the input is echoed (1 line, 15 characters).
        Parameters:
        net - The network code
        stat - The station code
        loc - The location code
        chan - The chanel code
        Returns:
        a PNZ with the response. If error, the PNZ might be incomplete
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error reading data or opening server

      • getOrientation

        public double[] getOrientation(java.lang.String net,
                               java.lang.String stat,
                               java.lang.String loc,
                               java.lang.String chan)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        get Orientation of the channel
        Parameters:
        net - network code
        stat - station code
        loc - location code
        chan - channel code
        Returns:
        3 element array 0=azimuth in degrees clockwise from north, 1=dip in degrees from horizontal, 2=depth in meters from surface.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if opening server is a problem
